resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.summary: VPC: Public IP confusion when Cloudformation template with VPC is Used.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: As a cloud user, I would like CloudFormation to support instances in a VPC, and EIPAssociation and NetworkInterfaces for those instances.

comments.body:
*Additional Information*

When I tried to delete the stack, I saw the following error:
{code}
# euform-delete-stack DockerStack --region tessai-group2@group2

# euform-describe-stacks --region tessai-group2@group2
STACK	DockerStack	DELETE_FAILED	The following resource(s) failed to delete: [DockerIPAddress].	Cloudformation Example => Run instance with userdata in security group	2014-12-23T23:23:25.860Z
OUTPUT	InstanceId	i-5d936f12
OUTPUT	AZ	one
OUTPUT	PublicIP	10.116.145.168
{code}

Here is the stack events output:
{code}
# euform-describe-stack-events DockerStack --region tessai-group2@group2

Now when an eip is associated with an instance, the instance attribute values are recalculated, so Fn::GetAtt 'PublicIp' should produce the right result.

Fix Verified.
Tested using the supplied stack from [~hspencer].
